data.name: Website Audit Fixes
data.body: <p><strong>*PM Note: Open this task if the client has given approval for at least partial fixes if not all.*<br /><br />Goal:</strong>Â Fix all issues uncovered in the Technical Audit by the Frontend team to improve website search visibility.</p> <strong>Deliverable(s):</strong> <ol> <li>If no dev space exists, create one accordingly.Â <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GFHG_ROhHhG45TscOBGkE6db1d_sVsLHLOT7wUmzz-Y/edit#bookmark=id.hni6yo7fe1yx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Follow best practices from here</a>.</li> <li>Breakdown of which tasks have been completed and questions/comments on those skipped.</li> </ol> <strong>Checklist:</strong> <ol> <li>All points from website fixes have been responded to accordingly</li> </ol> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GFHG_ROhHhG45TscOBGkE6db1d_sVsLHLOT7wUmzz-Y/edit#heading=h.42if8ygppblz" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Frontend Developerâs Instructions &amp; Guidelines</a><br /><br /><strong>Please perform all fixes on dev site first, once approved by PM, we will push them live.</strong><br /><br />When the audit fixes go live, we should be checking to make sure everything is set up and working correctly on the live site by using the checklist below:<br /><br /> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <ol> <li>New website can be restored at anytime via the backup file.</li> <li>Website loads on the proper domain - including all its elements such as images, javascript, etc. Use checker tools and also navigate through the site as a user.</li> <li>All page redirects are properly configured &amp; working as per [Workbook: Redirects] including www/non-www [Workbook: Website Plan - Onsite SEO - URL]</li> <li>No 3xx/4xx links on the site</li> <li>No references to dev server (links, images, css, js)</li> <li>Make sure robots.txt isnât blocking crawlers</li> <li>Make sure pages arenât noindex (if set via CMS)</li> <li>Contact form testing</li> <li>Advanced functionality/3rd party testing</li> <li>Enable cache and gzip</li> <li>Run page speed test to make sure it loads in &lt;2 seconds</li> <li>Make sure analytics are on all pages</li> <li><strong>implement redirects</strong></li> </ol>

data.name: WP Website Maintenance *O*
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Goal: </strong></span>To setup a new maintenance project, and log relevant maintenance updates and questions in this task.<br /></span></p> <h2><strong>Â </strong></h2> <h2><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task?Â </span></strong></span></h2> <h2><span style="text-decoration: none">At the beginning of a maintenance engagement</span></h2> <h2><strong>Â </strong></h2> <h2><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM:</span></h2> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before opening this task, please fill in the proper GForm (i.e. (Re)Start, Website Launch, PM Transfer, etc.) that adds the relevant maintenance details to </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/2/d/19SDNRqoOmsifVDtslETR-M5l7HbCAjwRIJtkZ4i4yMo/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Website Maintenance Master Sheet</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. For more details on beginning a maintenance engagement, please see the </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/18VtMHXoHQx9wHix2HFsy7QuGGbuN4A1vzhl_rdqd-jQ/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Maintenance Cheat Sheet.Â </span></a></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide WP admin access as well as hosting access to FED</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Once provided by FED, share the list of inactive WP plugins/themes with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Once provided by FED, share the list of WP users with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.<br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <h2><span style="text-decoration: underline">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></h2> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">One-Time (when opening this task, before MAINT label is added):</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check and list any inactive plugins and themes on the website, and provide the list to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed. </span><a href="https://www.godaddy.com/resources/skills/remove-wordpress-themes-plugins" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Why Should Inactive Plugins/Themes Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check and screenshot all WP users (showing active and inactive users), and provide that to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed.Â  </span><a href="https://wpactivitylog.com/inactive-users-wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Why Should Inactive or Spam Users Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Install the Wordfence plugin and set it up for the maintenance@ email to get the security notifications.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check all access (WP-admin, Cpanel/Hosting) for the website and confirm they are all working.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create/Setup monthly maintenance reports to go to the listed client email(s).</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Backups: Install the WP Backup plugin and set it up to take website backups every 15 days.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Recurring Checklist for ongoing maintenance:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Monitor the Wordfence security notification emails and if any issues are found, fix them immediately. (Daily)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Plugins/WP Core Update (Check weekly, and update within 15 days after local test was successful)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Security Check (Weekly)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Visual Site Inspections (Weekly)</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">It includes the frontend parts of the website:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">- Visual appearance of the web pages</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">- Responsiveness (for mobile, tablet, laptop and large screen)Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">- Browser compatibility:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">On mobile - Check on android (chrome) and iPhone (both chrome and safari)</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">On desktop - Check on Chrome, Safari and Firefox for computers</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">- Uneven or broken images (not what was intended in the theme layout)</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">- Broken pages/ layoutsÂ </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">- Formatting or alignment issues</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check for any potential spam WP users and inform the PM if any are found (Weekly)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Test all Forms on the site and make sure the client is receiving them as well (every two weeks)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check the WP Backup plugin to make sure a website backup is taken every 15 days. (every two weeks)</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Database Cleanup (Monthly)</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove Unapproved comments</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove Trashed posts</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove Auto-draft posts</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove Spam Comments</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Delete Post Revisions</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Delete Unused Plugins and Themes</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove/Disable Pingbacks and trackbacks</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unwanted Post and comment metadata</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to close task (and any final steps)?</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>Â </strong><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">This task should only be closed when a client cancels maintenance services.Â </span></p> <p>Â </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span></span></strong><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.bbicd8t2iv11" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.bbicd8t2iv11</span></a><span> </span></span></span></p>

data.name: Dev Edits
data.body: <p>1) We could not find social media handles for the site to include in the footer section. Please provide us with the respective social media URL of the client</p> <p><strong> The client is providing them. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p>2) Please provide us contact email for the client to also include in the footer currently it is Lorem Ipsum's email.  <strong>office@blackforestfloors.com</strong></p> <p>  </p> <p><strong>About Us Page:</strong></p> <p> 3) Currently, the text in âAbout Black Forestâ is still lorem ipsum. Please provide us with text to replace it with. <strong>You can use ChatGPT to fill in any missing content. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p>4) The profile cards of team members currently link to nowhere since there are no pages on the site for individual team members. Please mention if we should redirect them elsewhere or remove the empty redirects. <strong>Please hide this section. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Areas We Serve Page:</strong></p> <p> 5) We have used a dummy video in the services section. Please provide us with the actual video link/file.  <strong>Use a photo and remove the video. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Gallery Page:</strong></p> <p>6) In the Flooring section, we have adjusted the images and gallery as per the new design provided in comment #7. As there are 7 flooring categories being showcased currently but as discussed in task <a href="https://login.smartsites.com/projects/5836/tasks/308595" data-entity-type="Task" data-entity-id="308595">#94: Gallery Page</a> comment #11 it was discussed to keep all 9 categories. Please confirm if we should keep all 9 categories or if just 7 for now is enough. Also please provide us instructions for which image goes for respective flooring showcases in the respective section. <strong>Please keep all 9 categories.</strong> </p> <p> </p> <p>7) Please confirm where the âSee Moreâ Button should redirect to in the Flooring Showcase section.<strong> You can remove this CTA. </strong></p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>Please make sure all the links are correct. </strong></p> <p> </p>

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to open this task: </strong></span><br /> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER Website Audit fixes </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">IF additional page speed optimizations are still needed</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong> <span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>  [1:2]</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please always do these points:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the pagespeed after Frontendâs optimizations. If further improvements are still desired, changes to content is required. Please advise the following, and reassign to Frontend Dev. </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> [2:2]</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement Lazy loading</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement a separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once optimal page speed is achieved, or we exhausted all efforts within the limitations.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf</a></p>

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <p><strong>Mobile Speed Optimization *O*</strong></p> <br /> <p><strong>Goal:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p>Â </p> <p><strong>On FED:</strong></p> <p><strong>Please always do these points:</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">- Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">- Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">- Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcsetÂ </span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">-Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> <br /> <p>Â </p> <p><strong>Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Implement Lazy loading</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Implement separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On PM to advise:</strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Please confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></li> </ol>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]Â  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, âN/Aâ.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicableÂ </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â  [1/2]:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to open this task: </strong></span><br /> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER Website Audit fixes </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">IF additional page speed optimizations are still needed</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong> <span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>  [1:2]</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please always do these points:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the pagespeed after Frontendâs optimizations. If further improvements are still desired, changes to content is required. Please advise the following, and reassign to Frontend Dev. </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> [2:2]</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement Lazy loading</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement a separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once optimal page speed is achieved, or we exhausted all efforts within the limitations.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf</a></p>

(G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <p><strong>Mobile Speed Optimization *O*</strong></p> <br /> <p><strong>Goal:</strong><span> To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>On FED:</strong></p> <p><strong>Please always do these points:</strong></p> <p><span>- Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> <p><span>- Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> <p><span>- Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> <p><span>-Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> <br /> <p> </p> <p><strong>Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</strong></p> <ol> <li><span>Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></li> <li><span>Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></li> <li><span>Implement Lazy loading</span></li> <li><span>Implement separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On PM to advise:</strong></p> <ol> <li><span>Please confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></li> <li><span>If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></li> <li><span>Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></li> <li><span>If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></li> </ol>

data.name: Form Testing &amp; SMTP
data.body: <div class="rich_text"> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Open: <br /></strong></span><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Tracking task is completed<br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">REOPEN IF changes are made to forms or new forms are introduced</span></p> <p><span></span></p> <p> </p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span> E</strong>nsure proper sending, receipt &amp; conversion tracking for all forms on the website.</p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Instructions: </strong></span></p> <p><strong>On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </strong></p> <ol> <li>List of all separate forms on the website (duplicate occurrences of the same form are not needed) including fields and recipient email address(es). Make sure this matches with the form recipient per the Workbook. </li> <li>Send a test submission on each form to the clientâs recipient email and a test FED email. Confirm receipt  of email in FED email with screenshot &amp; check with PM that client has also received on their end.</li> <li>Check that the form submission conversion event is recorded correctly.  </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On PM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Confirm form fields and receipt of test email with client. </li> <li>If there are no issues, this task can be closed. </li> <li>If the client cannot receive the test form submissions, acquire SMTP email logins &amp; assign them to FED to implement SMTP. (2FA should be disabled) </li> <li>If the form is not properly tracked as a conversion event (and should be) please open or re-open the Website Tracking task.</li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>IF initial form testing was not successful, on <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>:</strong></p> <ol> <li>Setup SMTP, or if SMTP is not possible, setup client email to use as sender/receiver.</li> <li>Resend test email. Confirm receipt from client &amp; recheck conversion tracking. </li> </ol> <br /> <p>List of Extensions:</p> <p>Wordpress, WP Mail SMTP by WPForms: <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/</a></p> <p>Magento 2, Magento 2 SMTP Extension (MagePal): <a href="https://github.com/magepal/magento2-gmail-smtp-app" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://github.com/magepal/magento2-gmail-smtp-app</a></p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to close the task: </strong></span></p> <p>When the client has confirmed receipt of form submissions to the correct email address. </p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.mzc21w80hle5" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.mzc21w80hle5</a></p> <p><br /><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Tutorial: </span>TBD</p> </div>

(G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.Â  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM.Â </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If allÂ Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to open this task: </strong></span><br /> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER Website Audit fixes </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">IF additional page speed optimizations are still needed</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong> <span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>  [1:2]</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please always do these points:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the pagespeed after Frontendâs optimizations. If further improvements are still desired, changes to content is required. Please advise the following, and reassign to Frontend Dev. </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> [2:2]</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement Lazy loading</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement a separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once optimal page speed is achieved, or we exhausted all efforts within the limitations.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf</a></p>

data.name: Backlink Health Check
data.body: <h2><strong>When to open this task?</strong></h2> <ul> <li>At the beginning of a campaign</li> <li>Task will auto-spawn quarterly </li> </ul> <h2> </h2> <h2><strong>Billable?</strong></h2> <p>Yes </p> <p> </p> <h2><strong>Important Notes/Considerations:</strong></h2> <p>IndexMeNow is a paid service, so we will only use this for links that are not indexed naturally after 3 months. This task will replace the previous task <strong>Broken Links Check</strong></p> <h2> </h2> <p><strong>Goal:</strong>  Maintain a healthy backlink profile for the client<br /><br /><strong>Instructions:</strong><strong><br /></strong></p> <p><strong>On IBM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Proceed with filling out the broken links tab in the link building sheet &amp; advise next steps. </li> <li>Check for spammy backlinks to disavow &amp; advise next steps. </li> <li>Check for unindexed backlinks. Request Indexing via IndexMeNow if link was created longer than 3 months ago (i.e. since last Backlink Health Check). </li> <li>After the task is complete, update the <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1X7KV29YXwEZgO0_NbptPXrm1FLGLBP594Oup3__UvAM/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Master Linkbuilding List</a> with clientâs acquired links &amp; <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sZ6HVXME7KMM6uVx4gpmv-FkZclvuuy0E07-86QJRAw/edit#gid=1664165067" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Linkbuilding Blacklist</a> &amp; Greylist with unindexable backlinks.  <br /><br /></li> </ol> <p><strong>On PM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Review the list of broken links. </li> </ol> <ul> <li>For the tabs, broken internal links broken external links, and broken page with backlinks please task this out to the Frontend Team. </li> <li>If there are items found for the Lost Links tab, then task this out to the Inbound Marketing Team to get back.<br /><br /></li> </ul> <p>Review spammy backlink list. Provide IBM feedback or approve to disavow.  Unindexable links will be refunded. Sometimes this is due to  3xx or 4xx issues which can be resolved by finding &amp; resubmitting the correct URL. Troubleshoot with IBM. After a second failed resubmission we will consider the link unindexable and IBM will add to Greylist or Blacklist as appropriate.  <br /><br /><strong>When to close this task (and any next steps)?</strong></p> <ul> <li>Broken Links - FED &amp; IBM will confirm links have been resolved</li> <li>Spammy Links - IBM will provide screenshot of submitted disavow file. Google doesn't provide any further update on disavow submissions but will take care of it, so once submitted there is no further action needed.</li> <li>Unindexed Backlinks - IBM will provide screenshot of indexed backlinks. Refunded backlinks </li> <li>After resolving broken links, spammy backlinks &amp; unindexed backlinks &amp; IBM has updated the  <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1X7KV29YXwEZgO0_NbptPXrm1FLGLBP594Oup3__UvAM/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Master Linkbuilding List</a> &amp; <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sZ6HVXME7KMM6uVx4gpmv-FkZclvuuy0E07-86QJRAw/edit#gid=1664165067" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Linkbuilding Blacklist</a></li> </ul>

data.name: Updating Areas We Serve
data.body: <p><span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </p> <p>Here is a link to a video I put together explaining what needs to be done with the Areas We Serve section of the site, and attached below is the mp4 file: <a href="https://www.awesomescreenshot.com/video/38126521?key=a612655632ef6b085bde3b9b4a003600" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://www.awesomescreenshot.com/video/38126521?key=a612655632ef6b085bde3b9b4a003600</a></p> <p> </p> <p>to briefly summarize, we need the "Areas We Serve" tab removed from the main navigation and added to the footer.</p> <p> </p> <p>On this page we need to remove the "Explore our Reach" section.</p> <p> </p> <p>We also need to remove 3 of the boxes from the top, leaving only 3 tiles, one for:</p> <ol> <li>Northern Virginia</li> <li>Southern Maryland</li> <li>Washington DC</li> </ol> <p>Within these tiles we will have lists of the specific towns/cities that the client services.</p> <p> </p> <p>At the bottom of each title we will remove the phone number and "more info" button, in place of "Contact Us" which directs to the contact form.</p>

data.name: Website Maintenance - https://thepointeseniorliving.com/
data.body: <p>Please log relevant maintenance updates and questions in this task.</p> <h2>Checklist On FED:</h2> <p>One-Time (when opening this task, before MAINT label is added):</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check and list any inactive plugins and themes on the website, and provide the list to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed.<span style="text-decoration: underline">Â </span><a href="https://www.godaddy.com/resources/skills/remove-wordpress-themes-plugins" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Why Should Inactive Plugins/Themes Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Check and screenshot all WP users (showing active and inactive users), and provide that to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed.Â <span style="text-decoration: underline">Â </span><a href="https://wpactivitylog.com/inactive-users-wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Why Should Inactive or Spam Users Be Removed?</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Install the Wordfence plugin and set it up for the maintenance@ email to get the security notifications.</p> </li> <li> <p>Check all access (WP-admin, Cpanel/Hosting) for the website and confirm they are all working.</p> </li> <li> <p>Create/Setup monthly maintenance reports to go to the listed client email(s).</p> </li> <li> <p>Backups: Install the WP Backup plugin and set it up to take website backups every 15 days.</p> </li> </ol> <p>Â </p> <p>Recurring Checklist for ongoing maintenance:</p> <ol> <li> <p>Monitor the Wordfence security notification emails and if any issues are found, fix them immediately. (Daily)</p> </li> <li> <p>Plugins/WP Core Update (Check weekly, and update within 15 days after local test was successful)</p> </li> <li> <p>Security Check (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Visual Site Inspections (Weekly)</p> </li> </ol> <p>It includes the frontend parts of the website:<br />- Visual appearance of the web pages</p> <p>- Responsiveness (for mobile, tablet, laptop and large screen)Â </p> <p>- Browser compatibility:Â <br />On mobile - Check on android (chrome) and iPhone (both chrome and safari)Â <br />On desktop - Check on Chrome, Safari and Firefox for computers</p> <p>- Uneven or broken images (not what was intended in the theme layout)</p> <p>- Broken pages/ layoutsÂ </p> <p>-Â Formatting or alignment issues</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check for any potential spam WP users and inform the PM if any are found (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Test all Forms on the site and make sure the client is receiving them as well (every two weeks)</p> </li> <li> <p>Check the WP Backup plugin to make sure a website backup is taken every 15 days.Â (every two weeks)</p> </li> <li> <p>Database Cleanup (Monthly)</p> <ol> <li> <p>Remove Unapproved comments</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Trashed posts</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Auto-draft posts</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Spam Comments</p> </li> <li> <p>Delete Post Revisions</p> </li> <li> <p>Delete Unused Plugins and Themes</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove/Disable Pingbacks and trackbacks</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove unwanted Post and comment metadata</p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <h2>On PM:</h2> <p>Â </p> <ol> <li> <p>Before opening this task, please fill in the proper GForm (i.e. (Re)Start, Website Launch, PM Transfer, etc.) that adds the relevant maintenance details toÂ <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/2/d/19SDNRqoOmsifVDtslETR-M5l7HbCAjwRIJtkZ4i4yMo/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Website Maintenance Master Sheet</span></a></p> </li> <li> <p>Provide WP admin access as well as hosting access to FED</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of inactive WP plugins/themes with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of WP users with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> </ol>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">:Â </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p>Â </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanelÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git RepoÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev siteÂ  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tabÂ </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clientsÂ  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev siteÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clientâs live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clientâs CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p>

every 15 days.</p> </li> </ol> <p>Recurring Checklist for ongoing maintenance:</p> <ol> <li> <p>Monitor the Wordfence security notification emails and if any issues are found, fix them immediately. (Daily)</p> </li> <li> <p>Plugins/WP Core Update (Check weekly, and update within 15 days after local test was successful)</p> </li> <li> <p>Security Check (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Visual Site Inspections (Weekly)</p> </li> </ol> <p><br />It includes the frontend parts of the website:<br />- Visual appearance of the web pages</p> <p>- Responsiveness (for mobile, tablet, laptop and large screen)Â </p> <p>- Browser compatibility:<br />On mobile - Check on android (chrome) and iPhone (both chrome and safari)<br />On desktop - Check on Chrome, Safari and Firefox for computers</p> <p>- Uneven or broken images (not what was intended in the theme layout)</p> <p>- Broken pages/ layoutsÂ </p> <p>- Formatting or alignment issues</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check for any potential spam WP users and inform the PM if any are found (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Test all Forms on the site and make sure the client is receiving them as well (every two weeks)</p> </li> <li> <p>Check the WP Backup plugin to make sure a website backup is taken every 15 days. (every two weeks)</p> </li> <li> <p>Database Cleanup (Monthly)</p> <ol> <li> <p>Remove Unapproved comments</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Trashed posts</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Auto-draft posts</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove Spam Comments</p> </li> <li> <p>Delete Post Revisions</p> </li> <li> <p>Delete Unused Plugins and Themes</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove/Disable Pingbacks and trackbacks</p> </li> <li> <p>Remove unwanted Post and comment metadata</p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span>When to close task (and any final steps)?</span></strong><strong>Â </strong><br />This task should only be closed when a client cancels maintenance services.Â </p> <p>Â </p> <p><strong><span>Link to Manual:Â </span></strong><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.bbicd8t2iv11" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.bbicd8t2iv11</a></p>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]Â  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, âN/Aâ.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicableÂ </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â  [1/2]:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.Â  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM.Â </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If allÂ Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Content Implementation ($Month)
data.body: <strong>Goal</strong>: Implement SEO content onto the live site or dev site as indicated by the PM. This task is to be used when a full month of SEO content has been approved by the client and is ready for implementation the website.<br /><br /><strong>Deliverables on PM:<br /></strong>1. Provide content to FED (attachments, links, etc)<br />2. If photos are needed, please provide (attachments, adobe stock links, etc)<br />3. Indicate the location of where the content is to be added (blog, industries, locations, etc) via the link or specific location.<br />4. Specify live site or dev site.<br /><br /><strong>Checklist:</strong><br />1. Content is implemented on the website in the correct location with the correct content and applicable photos<br /><br />**Please duplicate this task and swap out the month and feel free to add additional details in the task if needed*

data.name: Content Implementation ($Month)
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When a full month of SEO content has been sent toÂ  the clientÂ  and is ready for implementation on the website.</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement SEO content onto the live site or dev site as indicated by the PM.Â </span></p> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Duplicate this task, &amp; customize the task name with the correct Month &amp; Year.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide the required information for FEDÂ </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Content: [Link to approved content, or indicated âattachedâ]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Photos: [Link to approved photos or indicated âattachedâ]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Page Details:Â </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For web pages, indicate the row of the website plan to reference for Onsite SEO &amp; url structureÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For blogs, indicate the row of the Ed. Calendar to check for blog category.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify whether pages should be scheduled, added to live, added as drafts, or created on dev.*Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inbound Internal Links to create: [Indicate if any pages should be added the website navigation structure, or linked to from any existing page (eg. When adding a service page, it may be logical to add a link from the âall servicesâ splash page)Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">*<span style="text-decoration: underline">NOTE:</span> Not recommended to create pages on dev unless this is a brand new page template. If clients wants approval, draft mode is much better. See </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Dev Site Changes Guid</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">e for more details.Â </span></p> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement content on the website in the correct location with the correct photos &amp; and onsite SEO. </span></li> <li>Ensure new content is implemented per [Workbook | Content Implementation QA] <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1E2-QnwWv-dmZO2UFxyGIC08EWSF5E0xW8UL7fxO-f1k/edit#gid=0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">(eg.)</a></li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once the monthâs content has been implemented on the site </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong> </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.ce3aco68a5j2" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.ce3aco68a5j2</span></a></p>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clientâs live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clientâs CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>
