data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]Â  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, âN/Aâ.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicableÂ </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â  [1/2]:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.Â  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM.Â </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If allÂ Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Backlink Health Check
data.body: <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task?</span></h3> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Immediately</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">A similar task will automatically open quarterlyÂ Â </span></p> </li> </ul> <h3><strong>Â </strong></h3> <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span></h3> <h3><span style="text-decoration: none">Maintain a healthy backlink profile for the client</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></h3> <h3><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â </span></h3> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill out the broken links tab in the link building sheet &amp; advise next steps.</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Broken Internal Links - Advise PM how to fix the link, and if details/clarification is needed from client be sure to request this information.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Broken External Links - Advise PM how to fix the link, and if details/clarification is needed from client be sure to request this information.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Broken Page With Backlink - Advise PM how to fix the link, and if details/clarification is needed from client be sure to request this information.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Lost Links- Attempt to reacquire any Lost Links that are worth pursuing. If not, please provide the reason.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check for spammy backlinks to disavow &amp; advise next steps.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment with the sheet and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/19PLtR50GgO8t2QpN72Kj2jMdmda-5_Nt0P4kYb4TQtc/edit#heading=h.xlt09odanqlj" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">clear instructions for the PM</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> on next steps.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <h3><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></h3> <h3><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM</span></h3> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the list of broken links</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For the tabs, broken internal links, broken external links, and broken page with backlinks please task this out to the <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If there are items found for the Lost Links tab, then task this out to the <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â to get back.</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the spammy backlink list. Provide <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> feedback or approve to disavow<br /></span></li> </ol> <br /> <h3><strong>Â </strong></h3> <h3><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to closeÂ </span></h3> <ul> <li> <p>Broken Links - FED &amp; IBM will confirm links have been resolved</p> </li> <li> <p>Spammy Links - IBM will provide a screenshot of the submitted disavow file. Once submitted there is no further action needed.</p> </li> <li> <p>After resolving broken links and spammy backlinks.</p> </li> </ul>
data.notes: Check if updating in one place resolves all the issues at once. Reset the due date saying "The site's bandwidth issue has been resolved so we are proceeding with the task."

data.name: Form Testing &amp; SMTP
data.body: <div class="rich_text"> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Open: <br /></strong></span><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Tracking task is completed<br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">REOPEN IF changes are made to forms or new forms are introduced</span></p> <p><span></span></p> <p> </p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span> E</strong>nsure proper sending, receipt &amp; conversion tracking for all forms on the website.</p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Instructions: </strong></span></p> <p><strong>On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </strong></p> <ol> <li>List of all separate forms on the website (duplicate occurrences of the same form are not needed) including fields and recipient email address(es). Make sure this matches with the form recipient per the Workbook. </li> <li>Send a test submission on each form to the clientâs recipient email and a test FED email. Confirm receipt  of email in FED email with screenshot &amp; check with PM that client has also received on their end.</li> <li>Check that the form submission conversion event is recorded correctly.  </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On PM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Confirm form fields and receipt of test email with client. </li> <li>If there are no issues, this task can be closed. </li> <li>If the client cannot receive the test form submissions, acquire SMTP email logins &amp; assign them to FED to implement SMTP. (2FA should be disabled) </li> <li>If the form is not properly tracked as a conversion event (and should be) please open or re-open the Website Tracking task.</li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>IF initial form testing was not successful, on <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>:</strong></p> <ol> <li>Setup SMTP, or if SMTP is not possible, setup client email to use as sender/receiver.</li> <li>Resend test email. Confirm receipt from client &amp; recheck conversion tracking. </li> </ol> <br /> <p>List of Extensions:</p> <p>Wordpress, WP Mail SMTP by WPForms: <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/</a></p> <p>Magento 2, Magento 2 SMTP Extension (MagePal): <a href="https://github.com/magepal/magento2-gmail-smtp-app" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://github.com/magepal/magento2-gmail-smtp-app</a></p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to close the task: </strong></span></p> <p>When the client has confirmed receipt of form submissions to the correct email address. </p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.mzc21w80hle5" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.mzc21w80hle5</a></p> <p><br /><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Tutorial: </span>TBD</p> </div>

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to open this task: </strong></span><br /> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER Website Audit fixes </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">IF additional page speed optimizations are still needed</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong> <span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>  [1:2]</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please always do these points:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcset </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the pagespeed after Frontendâs optimizations. If further improvements are still desired, changes to content is required. Please advise the following, and reassign to Frontend Dev. </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> [2:2]</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement Lazy loading</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement a separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once optimal page speed is achieved, or we exhausted all efforts within the limitations.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf</a></p>
data.notes: Analyze and give estimation first. Check the login access as well.

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">:Â </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p>Â </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanelÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git RepoÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev siteÂ  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tabÂ </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clientsÂ  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev siteÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clientâs live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clientâs CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p>

data.name: WP Website Maintenance *O*
data.body: <p>Please log relevant maintenance updates and questions in this task.</p> <h2>Checklist On FED:</h2> <p>One-Time (when opening this task, before MAINT label is added):</p> <ol> <li> <p>Check and list any inactive plugins and themes on the website, and provide the list to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed.Â <a href="https://www.godaddy.com/resources/skills/remove-wordpress-themes-plugins" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Why Should Inactive Plugins/Themes Be Removed?</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Check and screenshot all WP users (showing active and inactive users), and provide that to the PM to confirm with the client which of them can be removed. Â <a href="https://wpactivitylog.com/inactive-users-wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Why Should Inactive or Spam Users Be Removed?</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Install the Wordfence plugin and set it up for the maintenance@ email to get the security notifications.</p> </li> <li> <p>Check all access (WP-admin, Cpanel/Hosting) for the website and confirm they are all working.</p> </li> <li> <p>Create/Setup monthly maintenance reports to go to the listed client email(s).</p> </li> <li> <p>Backups: Install the WP Backup plugin and set it up to take website backups every 15 days.Â (NOTE : ForÂ websites using git, the backup plugin is not needed as we can use the git repo to restore the backups from the git version control.)</p> </li> </ol> <p>Â </p> <p>Recurring Checklist for ongoing maintenance:</p> <ol> <li> <p>Monitor the Wordfence security notification emails and if any issues are found, fix them immediately. (Daily)</p> </li> <li> <p>Plugins/WP Core Update (Check weekly, and update within 15 days after local test was successful)</p> </li> <li> <p>Security Check (Weekly)</p> </li> <li> <p>Visual Site Inspections (Weekly)</p> </li> </ol> <p>It includes the frontend parts of the website:<br />- Visual appearance of the web pages</p> <p>- Responsiveness (for mobile, tablet, laptop and large screen)Â </p> <p>- Browser compatibility:<br />On mobile - Check on android (chrome) and iPhone (both chrome and safari)<br />On desktop - Check on Chrome, Safari and Firefox for computers</p> <p>- Uneven or broken images (not what was intended in the theme layout)</p> <p>- Broken pages/ layoutsÂ </p> <p>- Formatting or alignment issues</p> <p><br />5. Check for any potential spam WP users and inform the PM if any are found (Weekly)</p> <p>Â </p> <p>6. Test all Forms on the site and make sure the client is receiving them as well (every two weeks)</p> <p>Â </p> <p>7. Check the WP Backup plugin to make sure a website backup is taken every 15 days. (every two weeks)</p> <p>Â </p> <p>8. Database Cleanup (Monthly)</p> <p>a. Remove Unapproved comments</p> <p>b. Remove Trashed posts</p> <p>c. Remove Auto-draft posts</p> <p>d. Remove Spam Comments</p> <p>e. Delete Post Revisions</p> <p>f. Delete Unused Plugins and Themes</p> <p>g.Â Remove/Disable Pingbacks and trackbacks<br />h.Â Remove unwanted Post and comment metadata<br /><br /></p> <p>9. Test Products (WooCommerce sites only) (Monthly)</p> <ol> <li> <p>Create a test Product/Coupon</p> </li> <li> <p>Add product to cart functionality</p> </li> <li> <p>Update the cart functionality</p> </li> <li> <p>Proceed to the checkout page</p> </li> <li> <p>On the final Checkout page (Check if the website has any tax/shipping calculating options, and if so confirm it is working fine)</p> </li> <li> <p>Test all payment options</p> </li> </ol> <h2>On PM:</h2> <ol> <li> <p>Before opening this task, please fill in the proper GForm (i.e. (Re)Start, Website Launch, PM Transfer, etc.) that adds the relevant maintenance details toÂ <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/2/d/19SDNRqoOmsifVDtslETR-M5l7HbCAjwRIJtkZ4i4yMo/edit?usp=sharing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Website Maintenance Master Sheet</a></p> </li> <li> <p>Provide WP admin access as well as hosting access to FED</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of inactive WP plugins/themes with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> <li> <p>Once provided by FED, share the list of WP users with the client and confirm which ones can be deleted.</p> </li> </ol>

data.name: Form Testing &amp; SMTP
data.body: <div class="rich_text"> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Open: <br /></strong></span><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Tracking task is completed<br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">REOPEN IF changes are made to forms or new forms are introduced</span></p> <p><span></span></p> <p> </p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span> E</strong>nsure proper sending, receipt &amp; conversion tracking for all forms on the website.</p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Instructions: </strong></span></p> <p><strong>On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </strong></p> <ol> <li>List of all separate forms on the website (duplicate occurrences of the same form are not needed) including fields and recipient email address(es). Make sure this matches with the form recipient per the Workbook. </li> <li>Send a test submission on each form to the clientâs recipient email and a test FED email. Confirm receipt  of email in FED email with screenshot &amp; check with PM that client has also received on their end.</li> <li>Check that the form submission conversion event is recorded correctly.  </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On PM</strong></p> <ol> <li>Confirm form fields and receipt of test email with client. </li> <li>If there are no issues, this task can be closed. </li> <li>If the client cannot receive the test form submissions, acquire SMTP email logins &amp; assign them to FED to implement SMTP. (2FA should be disabled) </li> <li>If the form is not properly tracked as a conversion event (and should be) please open or re-open the Website Tracking task.</li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>IF initial form testing was not successful, on <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>:</strong></p> <ol> <li>Setup SMTP, or if SMTP is not possible, setup client email to use as sender/receiver.</li> <li>Resend test email. Confirm receipt from client &amp; recheck conversion tracking. </li> </ol> <br /> <p>List of Extensions:</p> <p>Wordpress, WP Mail SMTP by WPForms: <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/</a></p> <p>Magento 2, Magento 2 SMTP Extension (MagePal): <a href="https://github.com/magepal/magento2-gmail-smtp-app" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://github.com/magepal/magento2-gmail-smtp-app</a></p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to close the task: </strong></span></p> <p>When the client has confirmed receipt of form submissions to the correct email address. </p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.mzc21w80hle5" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.mzc21w80hle5</a></p> <p><br /><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Tutorial: </span>TBD</p> </div>

data.name: Internal Linking
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize internal linking and increase page authority for important target pages.Â <br /><br /></span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Open This Task:</span></span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">During Onboarding </span><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Client has confirmed top pages and most valuable target keywords. This should be confirmed during Keyword Research task + SEO Brief.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">During campaign</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">IF/WHEN</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> new important pages are added, or if you want to increase authority of a specific page or set of pages on the site.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">During a campaign </span><span style="text-decoration: none">IF</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> you notice a blog or webpage which is getting lots of impressions and no clicks to increase internal authority and reinforce targetÂ  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">keywords<br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Indicate the pages &amp; target keyword(s) youâd link to check for interlinking opportunities. For basic interlinking, begin with the âTop Pagesâ from SEO Brief.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm keywords optimized for </span><a href="https://backlinko.com/hub/seo/search-intent" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">search intent</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> &amp; achievable </span><a href="https://www.searchenginejournal.com/keyword-competition/313815/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">search volume/difficulty ratio</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> have been selected for those target pages. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Search clientâs site for internal link opportunities. Include pages where the target anchor text already exists, and opportunities to insert it with suggestions. </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1gjat_CXBCUOy1_Ulk3v1Z-K3Oz4aVAKYOON7DAmkX5g/edit#gid=0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">Example deliverable.Â </span></a></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reassign to PM to check. (PM has option to immediately reassign to CON, time permitting</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span> *O*</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Check IBMâs suggestions for anchor text replacement for grammar &amp; syntax. (If time is pressing, this can be done by PM) </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [2/2]</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review suggestions and share with client for approval if desired. Once approved, reassign to FED for implementation</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement links + anchor text per approved keyword sheet.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">*O* If requested by PM, provide crawl results showing anchor text for target pages.<br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Final Deliverable(s):</span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Internal pages pointing toward target pages with optimized anchor text.</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to close task</span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">When PM confirms pages have been interlinked as requested.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span></strong></p> <p><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.nnh4prq54a65" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: none">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.nnh4prq54a65</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></a></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Tutorial:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">TBD</span></p>

data.name: Category Page Content *E*
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When assigning SEO Hours in an Ecommerce Project</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">IF there is a need to review, audit, and add to/optimize Category Page Content</span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">To audit Category Page content for SEO Value, and those opportunities for optimizations</span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Crawl category pages. Note which have &lt;250 words.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review competitor category pages and make optimization suggestions.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><span class="Apple-tab-span"> </span></span><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Determine which are missing content and need 250 words added, or those pages that have room for improvement whether it be word count or KeyWord use.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide the PM with the list of those pages that may need new content written or those that need content to be revised/optmized.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On PMÂ </span></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Assign in the recommended rewrites inÂ  Monthly SEO OpsÂ  </span></li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once onsite category page content is implemented</span></p> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.6jmy3myi2k5d" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.6jmy3myi2k5d</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p>
data.notes: Reach out to Shrawan dai regarding this

data.name: Mobile Speed Optimization *O*
data.body: <span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to open this task:Â </strong></span><br /> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER Website Audit fixesÂ </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">IF additional page speed optimizations are still needed</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal: </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>Â </strong>To optimize the mobile page speed issues</span></p> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></strong></p> <p>Â </p> <p><strong>Â <span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â  [1:2]</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please always do these points:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Unload third-party resources on mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Optimize the images, videos, compressing them and implementing caching.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate image size for mobile and desktop by using image srcsetÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Use responsive image offered by WordPress (Image srcset)</span></p> </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PMÂ </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the pagespeed after Frontendâs optimizations. If further improvements are still desired, changes to content is required. Please advise the following, and reassign to Frontend Dev.Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm if it's okay to use different content on desktop and mobile.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If yes to point 1, please indicate which content should show up ONLY on desktop and not on mobile (Consult with client if needed). If mobile is more than 2 or 2.5 folds, we would suggest omitting any less important content.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please advise If we should add Lazy load resources/sections below the second fold.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we should have a different design layout for mobile, open up a mobile design mockup task for the homepage and any other complex/very important pages, i.e. if you have a complex design layout, for example if it has a lot of elements, sections and/or dynamic parts.</span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> [2:2]</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Upon PM approval (see below list) please do:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Separate Mobile content (Such as Image, videos according to viewport size. )</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Remove unnecessary blocks/ sections on mobile</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement Lazy loading</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Implement a separate Design Layout that supports mobile page speed.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once optimal page speed is achieved, or we exhausted all efforts within the limitations.</span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span></p> <p>Â </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.5suyzgindjtf</a></p>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">:Â </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p>Â </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanelÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git RepoÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev siteÂ  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tabÂ </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clientsÂ  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev siteÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clientâs live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clientâs CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]Â  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, âN/Aâ.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicableÂ </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â  [1/2]:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.Â  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM.Â </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If allÂ Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clientâs live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clientâs CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: Site Backup
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span></strong></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong> </strong>As soon as we have hosting/cPanel access. <strong>For Shopify</strong>, please close this task right away. </span></p> <div align="left"> <p><br /><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Goal:</strong></span>  Create a backup in case someone goes wrong and we need to revert to the previous website version. We also use the site backup to create a test environment for development.<br /><br /></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Instructions:</strong></span><br /><strong>ON PM: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Before assigning this task make sure the site access logins are in the workbook</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On  <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Link to the backup zip file on GDrive (containing all folders and database SQL)</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong></span> When FED shares a link to site backup in Google Drive. </p> <p><br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span></strong> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0</span></a> </p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Tutorial</strong></span><strong>: </strong>TBD</p> </div>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]Â  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, âN/Aâ.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicableÂ </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â  [1/2]:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.Â  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM.Â </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If allÂ Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

Otherwise, âN/Aâ.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicableÂ </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â  [1/2]:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.Â  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM.Â </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If allÂ Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: URL check
data.body: <p><span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> per this task <a href="https://login.smartsites.com/projects/3503/tasks/323854" data-entity-type="Task" data-entity-id="323854" data-replacement="name">Backlink Health Check</a>, please check the URL change and confirm<span>Â whether updating the slug URL will affect the entire website and client SEO. Before changing the URL, we need to understand the potential effects. For instance, if the old URL already has a good ranking, changing it without checking could result in ranking loss. Additionally, within the website, if the URL is already linked to many pages, we'll need to update those links as well.</span></p> <p>Â </p> <p>If there will be high impact, redirect the broken URL is the most possible solutions for now.</p> <p>Â </p> <p>Thanks!</p>
