data.name: Website Audit Fixes
data.body: <p><strong>*PM Note: Open this task if the client has given approval for at least partial fixes if not all.*<br /><br />Goal:</strong>Â Fix all issues uncovered in the Technical Audit by the Frontend team to improve website search visibility.</p> <strong>Deliverable(s):</strong> <ol> <li>If no dev space exists, create one accordingly.Â <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GFHG_ROhHhG45TscOBGkE6db1d_sVsLHLOT7wUmzz-Y/edit#bookmark=id.hni6yo7fe1yx">Follow best practices from here</a>.</li> <li>Breakdown of which tasks have been completed and questions/comments on those skipped.</li> </ol> <strong>Checklist:</strong> <ol> <li>All points from website fixes have been responded to accordingly</li> </ol> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GFHG_ROhHhG45TscOBGkE6db1d_sVsLHLOT7wUmzz-Y/edit#heading=h.42if8ygppblz">Frontend Developerâs Instructions &amp; Guidelines</a><br /><br /><strong>Please perform all fixes on dev site first, once approved by PM, we will push them live.</strong><br /><br />When the audit fixes go live, we should be checking to make sure everything is set up and working correctly on the live site by using the checklist below:<br /><br /> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <ol> <li>New website can be restored at anytime via the backup file.</li> <li>Website loads on the proper domain - including all its elements such as images, javascript, etc. Use checker tools and also navigate through the site as a user.</li> <li>All page redirects are properly configured &amp; working as per [Workbook: Redirects] including www/non-www [Workbook: Website Plan - Onsite SEO - URL]</li> <li>No 3xx/4xx links on the site</li> <li>No references to dev server (links, images, css, js)</li> <li>Make sure robots.txt isnât blocking crawlers</li> <li>Make sure pages arenât noindex (if set via CMS)</li> <li>Contact form testing</li> <li>Advanced functionality/3rd party testing</li> <li>Enable cache and gzip</li> <li>Run page speed test to make sure it loads in &lt;2 seconds</li> <li>Make sure analytics are on all pages</li> <li><strong>implement redirects</strong></li> </ol>
data.notes: If optimization can be done, let do, do not add app for now

data.name: Content Implementation ($Month)
data.body: <p><strong>Goal</strong>: Implement SEO content onto the live site or dev site as indicated by the PM. This task is to be used when a full month of SEO content has been approved by the client and is ready for implementation the website.<br /><br /><strong>Deliverables on PM:<br /></strong>1. Provide content to FED (attachments, links, etc)<br />2. If photos are needed, please provide (attachments, adobe stock links, etc)<br />3. Indicate the location of where the content is to be added (blog, industries, locations, etc) via the link or specific location.<br />4. Specify live site or dev site.<br /><br /></p> <p>On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span><br /><strong>Checklist:</strong><br />1. Content is implemented on the website in the correct location with the correct content and applicable photos</p> <div class="rich_text">2. Onsite SEO descriptions have been added to each page via the Yoast SEO plugin.<br />3. All newly added pages have been indexed by default.</div> <p>**Please duplicate this task and swap out the month and feel free to add additional details in the task if needed*</p>
data.notes: Check if indexed, keep the task on us, for the gap of 4 days to review for the indexing

data.name: Site migration???
data.body: <p><span class="mention mention-user">Jadeverett Mayhorn</span> the client signed up for a domain transfer and web hosting with T35 however they seemed very confused. I helped them complete the domain transfer but then we discovered their current hosting was blocking their site from being indexed by google via robots.txt (seemed intentional/malicious perhaps?). I fixed the robots.txt issue and let the client know.</p> <p><br />Below is the last message i sent to the client via the T35 helpdesk - I believe you might need to help guide them to those next steps unless they have another developer working on that.</p> <p>Â </p> <p>Also, I set up the correct email zones for the domain on our hosting proactively (client seems to use Gsuite).</p> <p>Â </p> <div class="msgwrap"> <div class="message markdown-content"> <p><em>I fixed the robots.txt file, so Google should be able to index the site again - it might take them a day or two though.</em></p> <p>Â </p> <p><em>But just as a reminder, while the domain is transferred to T35 Hosting and you signed up for a hosting account with us, you still need someone to transfer the site and adjust the domain pointing. Otherwise it will continue to load from the current (previous?) webhost.</em></p> </div> </div>

Some pages don't exist yet, for those pages we should duplicate the layouts from existing pages (client shared that info with us in the table) and then later we will replace photos and text.</li> </ol> <p>Â </p> <p>Please see notes from the client here, additionally:</p> <div> <blockquote> <div>Here are the first changes for your team to make. Please reach out with any questions you have. The first changes are simply restructuring the Menu Bar, its drop-down menus, and the items that appear in those drop-downs. It also involves linking those drop-down items to the pages (templates) I wantâsome of which are not the pages they currently link to.</div> <div>Â </div> <div>The UI changes are very minimal right now: renaming a new Menu Bar items and drop-down items, as well as getting rid of the little ^ that appears in the menu bar.</div> <div>Â </div> <div>These two documents should explain it clearly (I hope)!</div> </blockquote> </div> <p>Â </p> <p>If you guys have any questions let me know. Thank you!</p>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">:Â </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p>Â </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanelÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git RepoÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev siteÂ  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tabÂ </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clientsÂ  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev siteÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clientâs live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clientâs CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]Â  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, âN/Aâ.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicableÂ </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â  [1/2]:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.Â  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM.Â </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If allÂ Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â  [1/2]:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.Â  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM.Â </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If allÂ Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">:Â </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p>Â </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanelÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git RepoÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev siteÂ  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tabÂ </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clientsÂ  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev siteÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clientâs live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clientâs CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p>

data.name: Redirects Planning *R*
data.body: <p><strong>Goal</strong>: Match up each old site webpage URL to a new site URL so users+search are properly redirected.</p> <br /><strong>Deliverable(s):</strong>Â List of all Old Site URLs (column A) each matched to an equivalent new site URL (column B). [Workbook: Redirects Setup]<br /><br /><strong>Checklist:</strong> <p>1. [Workbook: Redirects]</p> <ol> <li>List of Old Site URLs contains all webpages. (column A)<br />-Â  crawl the site using Screaming Frog, resulting list of URLs<br />- check GSC 1 year performance for top pages, resulting list of URLs<br />- check Ahrefs Best by Links, resulting list of URLs<br />- check Ahrefs Top Pages, resulting list of URLs<br />- merge the list of URLs, remove any duplicates.<br />- crawl the new dev site to get all of the new site URLs with Screamingfrog</li> <li>New Site URL is completely filled. (column B) via mapping the old URLs to the most relevant page URL on the new dev site.</li> <li>New Site URLs are matched to the most logical &amp; relevant pages.</li> </ol> 2. Check and suggest fixes if there are inconsistencies with dev site URLs and the planned page urls outlined in the website plan.<br /><br /><strong>On PM:Â </strong>Open this task at the end of the development phase when it looks like no more new pages will be created, pages will be merged or split up. Before opening this task on IBM, please provide the (old) live site URL as well as the (new) dev site URL. Once the list of redirects has been provided by IBM double-check if the redirects make sense (new pages are related to old pages) and if all good, mark this task complete and open the task "Redirects Setup - Dev Site *R*".Â

Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>

data.name: 2FA Authentication
data.body: <p><span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </p> <p>Â </p> <p>Can we enable 2FA Authentication for the clients site for the clients WP site that we will still be able to log in and perform work in order to prevent and potential malware attack?</p> <p>Â </p> <div> <div> <table> <tbody> <tr> <td> <table> <tbody> <tr> <td> <p><strong>Rafael F.</strong>Â (Automattic)</p> <p>Mar 25, 2025, 16:53 UTC</p> <div>Hi there,<br />Â <br />During a routine security scan ofÂ <strong><a href="http://ousialabs.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ousialabs.com</a></strong>, our systems identified malware and we have taken immediate action to secure your site. You can see a history of fixed security threats here:Â <a href="https://wordpress.com/scan/history/ousialabs.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://wordpress.com/scan/history/ousialabs.com</a>Â <br />Â <br />Our investigation identified that the local Administrator accountÂ <code>Smarty</code>Â (<a href="mailto:google@smartsites.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">google@smartsites.com</a>) was used to add malware to your site.<br />Â <br />To ensure the security of your site, we have removed the malware and taken the following actions:<br /> <ul> <li>Deleted theÂ <code>WordPress Core</code>Â fake plugin.</li> <li>Reset Smarty's password.</li> </ul> Â <br /> <h2>Recommended Security Actions</h2> To further secure your site, weÂ <strong>strongly</strong>Â recommend the following steps be taken as soon as possible:<br />Â <br /> <ol> <li><strong>Update passwords:</strong>Â UseÂ <a href="https://wordpress.com/support/passwords/#selecting-a-strong-password" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">strong, unique passwords</a>Â for your WordPress.com account and your WP Admin site login. We recommend any other site Administrators do the same too.</li> <li><strong>Enable two-step authentication:</strong>Â Add an extra layer of security to your WordPress.com account byÂ <a href="https://wordpress.com/support/security/two-step-authentication/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">enabling two-step authentication</a>.</li> <li><strong>Review Administrator users:</strong>Â Check your siteâs list of Administrators atÂ <a href="https://ousialabs.com/wp-admin/users.php?role=administrator" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://ousialabs.com/wp-admin/users.php?role=administrator</a>Â Â and remove any who are unauthorized or demote users to a lower role if they donât need full control over your site.</li> <li><strong>Review plugins and themes:</strong>Â Remove any unused plugins or themes, and ensure all installed plugins and themes areÂ <a href="https://wordpress.com/support/plugins/update-a-plugin-or-theme/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">updated to their latest version</a>.</li> </ol> Â <br />If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to let us know.<br /> <div> <p><strong>Rafael F.</strong><br />Happiness Engineer at WordPress.com</p> <p>Need a website fast?Â <a href="https://wordpress.com/website-design-service/?utm_campaign=happiness" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Let us build it for you</a>Â in four business days or less.</p> </div> </div> <p>Â </p> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </div> </div> <p>Â </p> <div>This email is a service from Automattic.</div>
data.notes: Wordfence gives option to setup 2FA.

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, âN/Aâ.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicable </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns. </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>  [1/2]: </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">  </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM. </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]: </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If all Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published. </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>
data.notes: Check if dynamic is possible and confirm with PM which contents should we implement out of 4.

data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]Â  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, âN/Aâ.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicableÂ </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â  [1/2]:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.Â  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM.Â </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If allÂ Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>
data.notes: First check if we can make anything dynamic.

data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span></strong></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>Â </strong>As soon as we have hosting/cPanel access. <strong>For Shopify</strong>, please close this task right away.Â </span></p> <div align="left"> <p><br /><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Goal:</strong></span>Â Â Create a backup in case someone goes wrong and we need to revert to the previous website version. We also use the site backup to create a test environment for development.<br /><br /></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Instructions:</strong></span><br /><strong>ON PM:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Before assigning this task make sure the site access logins are in the workbook</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On Â <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Link to the backup zip file on GDrive (containing all folders and database SQL)</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong></span>Â When FED shares a link to site backup in Google Drive.Â </p> <p><br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span></strong>Â <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0</span></a>Â </p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Tutorial</strong></span><strong>: </strong>TBD</p> </div>

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clientâs live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clientâs CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>
data.notes: Confirm the access and tell PM to reply on his checklist based on task description.

data.name: Configure Development Environment
data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">: </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.) </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong> </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanel </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git Repo </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev site  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tab </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clients  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev site </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site. </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clientâs live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP. </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS: </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">. </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clientâs CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span></p>
data.notes: Answer the question and tell the PM to reply on his checklist as well.

data.name: Add Accordion Style FAQ
data.body: <p>Hi <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span> ,</p> <p>Â </p> <p><a href="https://ptcnj.smartwebsitedesign.com/our-treatments/cleft-lift-procedure/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://ptcnj.smartwebsitedesign.com/our-treatments/cleft-lift-procedure/</a></p> <p>Â </p> <p>Can you please add to the bottom of the page an accordion style faq with these FAQ's.</p> <p>Â </p> <p><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EUZdfGSV6aGFVMRW8c9Kwg6FS0owuyRs/edit?usp=sharing&amp;ouid=111264776403592168833&amp;rtpof=true&amp;sd=true" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1EUZdfGSV6aGFVMRW8c9Kwg6FS0owuyRs/edit?usp=sharing&amp;ouid=111264776403592168833&amp;rtpof=true&amp;sd=true</a></p>

data.name: Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions
data.body: <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task:</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER the Website Plan has been completed [see important considerations]Â  </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>:</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Fill in onsite SEO for approved Website Plan. This should include:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Target Keyword: filled for non-Company pages. Otherwise, âN/Aâ.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Header, Titles &amp; URLs &amp; Meta descriptions filled in for all of the pages</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Features Target Keyword whenever applicableÂ </span></p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Important Considerations:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This is by far &amp; away the most important task in our SEO process.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">This deliverable can be overwhelming for clients to review/approve. If the client has over 40 pages to check, consider:</span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Breaking it down into specific rows/groups of pages to have client review in order of importance.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Moving Onsite SEO to a separate spreadsheet to isolate/hide the extra distracting columns.Â </span></p> </li> </ul> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">To avoid delay opening this task, you can begin with only âexisting pagesâ or only batches of pages which have been approved by client. </span><span style="text-decoration: none">It is better to write &amp; implement 10 pages than write but not implement 1000.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions: </span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span>Â  [1/2]:Â </span></strong></p> <ol> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Enter the list of all indexable pages along with their current onsite SEO in the website plan tab.</span> <ul> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">URL, Target Keyword (SV + KWD), Additional Keywords, Old H1 , Old Title, Old Metas</span></li> </ul> </li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Confirm all pages are listed in the website plan and organized per our template structure</span><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></li> <li><span style="text-decoration: none">Highlight any cells where Titles, H1s &amp; Meta descriptions are indicated as missing, duplicate or long in the Technical Audit. (G43-G45)</span></li> <li>Write New Headers and Titles. If the existing headers and titles include the optimized target keywords, are relevant, and follow SEO best practices, there is no need to re-write. Simply write âkeepâ in the âNewâ column. <ul> <li>Reassign to Content Team to check/write meta descriptions.</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">OnÂ  <span class="mention mention-user">Content Team</span>:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Proofread headers &amp; titles for grammar/syntax, and rewrite as needed.</span><span style="text-decoration: none">Â Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Review the existing meta descriptions. If they include the indicated target keywords, are relevant and </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZSQ5NbFo_cG4cXzPIKnurIAo71jBR6jFUcrz9iYREw4/edit?gid=2006941339#gid=2006941339" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">follow SEO best practices</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">, there is no need to re-write, simply write âkeepâ in the âNew Meta Descriptionâ column.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If it needs to be written or re-written, please write meta descriptions, including the target keyword.</span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On PM [1/2]:</span></strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Please review and share with the client. [See important considerations &amp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xxp9t8Z80MM5Slq7jHPaXc1fsEylaRDOPlv_ykPowNg/edit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> email template</a>]</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">After getting approval, please re-assign to FED to implement.</span></p> </li> </ol> <strong><span style="text-decoration: none"><br />On <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </span></strong><br /> <ol> <li>Please implement approved Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions, ensuring that this does not impact other website elements like site navigation.Â  <ul> <li>Target keyword</li> <li>Title</li> <li>Header</li> <li>Meta description</li> </ul> </li> </ol> <br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: none">On <span class="mention mention-user">Inbound Marketing Team</span> [2/2]:<br /></span></strong> <ol> <li>Please confirm proper implementation of Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions by pulling missing/duplicate/ titles, headers, and meta description data from Screaming Frog. <ul> <li>Issues regarding ânoindexâ pages or pages otherwise unimportant for SEO (eg. paginated pages, legal/admin pages, etc.) can be ignored.</li> <li>If any issues appear in the crawl but data is not available in the workbook, please request it from the PM.Â </li> </ul> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong>On PM [2/2]:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If allÂ Titles, H1s &amp; Meta Descriptions has been implemented, proceed to close the task.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If we only completed the first batch or ScreamingFrog still shows issues, repeat writing, approval, and implementation as needed until all descriptions are published.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close:</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Once all optimized H1s, Titles &amp; Meta descriptions have been implemented &amp; Screaming Frog confirms no Onsite SEO issues on </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><strong>indexable</strong> </span><span style="text-decoration: none">pages.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Manual:</strong></span> <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.10gdsc5qm8im</a></p>

data.body: <strong>Goal:Â </strong>Create a backup in case something goes wrong + something we use to create test environment for development.<br /><br /> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <ol> <li>Add as a backup-original.zip to GDrive</li> </ol> <br /><strong>ON PM:</strong><br />Provide logins to current website for frontend dev team to create a safety backup.<br /><br /><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GFHG_ROhHhG45TscOBGkE6db1d_sVsLHLOT7wUmzz-Y/edit#bookmark=id.cpmxbgkmaqnr" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Sergeyâs Instructions &amp; Guidelines</a>

We also use the site backup to create a test environment for development.<br /><br /></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Instructions:</strong></span><br /><strong>ON PM:Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Before assigning this task make sure the site access logins are in the workbook</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><strong>On Â <span class="mention mention-user">Frontend Dev Team</span>Â </strong></p> <ol> <li> <p>Link to the backup zip file on GDrive (containing all folders and database SQL)</p> </li> </ol> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>When to Close:</strong></span>Â When FED shares a link to site backup in Google Drive.Â </p> <p><br /><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual:</span></strong>Â <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.acvi577rfsy0</span></a>Â </p> <br /> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><strong>Link to Tutorial</strong></span><strong>: </strong>TBD</p> </div>

data.body: <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Task Description</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to open this task</span><span style="text-decoration: none">:Â </span></p> <ul> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">AFTER we have full access to the site (hosting &amp; CMS)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">BEFORE doing any dev work on the site</span></p> </li> </ul> <p><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Goal:</span><span style="text-decoration: none"> </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">Create a development environment using a copy of their existing site where the website changes &amp; fixes can be tested before moving to the production (live) environment.</span><strong><br /></strong></p> <p>Â </p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">Instructions:</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">ON PM:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Before assigning this task to Frontend Team, please provide the following:</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Provide URL of live domain</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Specify which CMS it is (i.e. Custom backend, WP, WP+Woocommerce, Magento1, Magento2, etc.)Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">As we are copying the existing live site on the dev environment, make sure the site access is in the workbook before assigning this task.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Inform FED if the client has their own developers so that Collaboration Flow information can be documented internally.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><strong>Â </strong></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">On Frontend Dev: </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on Wordpress:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create SmartWebsiteDesign.com Subdomain URL &amp; cPanelÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Create Git RepoÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Make sure the dev siteÂ  is blocked via robots.txt &amp; is not being tracked with GA.</span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Comment accordingly with the deliverables, and add it to the Workbook [Logins] tabÂ </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Disable Pro/Premium plugins on our dev site.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Reactivate the Pro &amp; Premium plugins with the proper licensing</span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">For plugins where Smartsites has unlimited licenses or licenses that can be used for clientsÂ  (eg. Gravity form, WP Rocket etc.) please use this license for the dev siteÂ </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If sharable licenses are not available, please request for the PM/client to provide the plugin licensing details. The client may need to purchase additional licenses to use on the dev site.Â </span></p> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Note: The purpose of the dev site is to test changes on an environment which is as similar to the clientâs live site as possible. Missing plugins licenses may cause inaccuracies in testing, so we strongly advise to address all licensing issues ASAP.Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the client is on another CMS:Â </span></p> <ol> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">Follow the CMS-specific guide </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Z8LoUr6jhyHTDkQ9LQfxlIB65J6RlMJ3QWhhTezkvo/edit?tab=t.0" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">here</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">.Â </span></p> </li> <li> <p><span style="text-decoration: none">If the clientâs CMS is not already represented in the guide, please research solutions and discuss with the PM. Once a solution is decided, add the procedure to the guide for future reference. </span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none"><br /><br /></span></p> </li> </ol> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline">When to Close: </span><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: none">When development environment is created and logged in the workbook</span></p> <p><span style="text-decoration: underline"><br /></span><span style="text-decoration: underline">Link to Manual: </span><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><span style="text-decoration: underline">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Da2PcJZ_pCLqTdQIiUTECN5tYshVaQdA84Vr9WSNiOk/edit#heading=h.7yewl7f6d2fn</span></a><span style="text-decoration: none">Â </span></p>
